respStmt.resp: XML encoding, hyperlinking and textual cleanup

availability.p: This text may be freely distributed, subject to the following restrictions:

list.item: You credit Perseus, as follows, whenever you use the document: Text provided by Perseus Digital Library, with funding from The U.S. Department of Education and The Max Planck Society.
You leave this availability statement intact.
You offer Perseus any modifications you make.

notesStmt.note: Initial XML cleanup by Alpheios Technical Services, LLC.
Major XML restructuring and text-correction by Winfried H. Leclaire of quranic-research.net
Additional proofreading by Naveed Ul Islam of lanelexicon.com

list.item: First issue published by Perseus Digital Library on 07th April 2011

entry.sense: ka prefixed to a noun is called kaAfu Alt-aXobiyhi The k of comparison. Respecting its being prefixed to pronouns, see Oano, suprà, p. 106.
UijoEalo hecaA AlX-aIoCa kaOosFA waAHidFA Make thou this thing to be [uniform, or] of one way, or mode, or manner. (ISk, in TA, art. bOj.)
kacelika The like thereof; such like; and simply such; and so.
kaUK and kMCK: see kaOaI-K or kaOay-ino voce OaI-N.
kamaA followed by a pret. often means Like as when: see an ex. in a verse cited above, p. 740.
kamaA is often followed by a pret. in the sense of an aor.: see exs. in EM., pp. 41 & 214.
kamaA Oanota waziyodFA [Keep as, or where, thou art, and approach not Zeyd! like makaAnaka wazayodFA]. Heard by Ks. (L, art. End.)
kamaAOanotaniI Wait for me where thou art! Heard by Az from certain of the Benoo-Suleym. (L, art. End.)

k of allocution is varied like the pronominal affix of the sec. pers., accord. to the sex and number of the persons addressed: see exs. in the Ḳur, iii. 42 and xix. 21 (Flügel's ed., and Lees' Keshsháf), xii. 37, ii. 46, &c., and xii. 32. But sometimes the same form is used in addressing a number of persons as in addressing one man: see, for ex., Ḳur, iv. 96.
1. kabana: see Sabana.
kabana Alv-awoba: see gabana.
kabaA: said of a horse: see above, art. Hanaca, p. 656 b.
See also a phrase voce sal-apN.
kabaA He fell upon his face: (Ḳ, TA:) or so kabaA liwajohihi: (Ṣ, TA:) and kabAa also signifies Eavara [he stumbled, or tripped]. (TA.)
R. Q. 1. katokata: see TaHoTaHa.
kutokutN The coarse part of silk, and of tow, &c.

kitaAbN (same as EaqodN) The ceremony (not certificate) of a marriage-contract. katabuwAkitaAbahu EalaI fulaAnapK They performed the ceremony of the contract of his marriage to such a woman (same as EqdwA Eaqodahu).
Oaholu AlkitaAbi: see OaholN.
katifN [The shoulder-blade;] a wide bone behind the shoulder-joint. (Mgh.)
[Hence, The shoulder itself.] See Tur-apN and muWur-abN.
kutofAanN, as an epithet applied to the locust, see in TA, voce musay-aHN. See also jaraAdN.
kitaAfN of a zabiyl: see HatiI-N.
katiyfapN i. q. Dab-apN A broad piece of iron. A poet speaks of a wooden vessel of which a fracture is mended with a ktyfp. (Ṣ.)
2. kat-alahu, inf. n. takotiylN, He made it (OaqiT [&c.]) into lumps, or compact pieces or portions. (TA.)
And He, or it, fattened him. (Kr, TA.)
5. takat-ala It became compacted together in a mass; it became lumpy. See qiyda, art. qwd.

kutolapN A lump, or compact piece or portion, (Ṣ, M,* Mṣb, Ḳ,) of a thing, (Mṣb,) or of gum, &c., (Ṣ,) or of dates, and of clay, &c.: (M, Ḳ:) a piece, or portion, of dates packed together in a receptacle: (Mgh:) and a piece of flesh-meat. (Ḳ.)
ktlp i. q. zabiylN. (TA in art. HSn.)

mikotalN A zinobiyl, (Mṣb, Ḳ,) or thing like a zinobiyl, [or zabiyl,] (Ṣ,) holding fifteen measures of the quantity termed SaAE; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) it is a thing [or basket] made of palm-leaves, in which dates, &c., are carried. (Mṣb.)
mukat-alN Round and compact; (Ḳ;) applied to a head: (TA:) short (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA) and strong: (TA:) a man thick in body, (Ḳ, TA,) compact therein, and inclining to shortness. (TA.)
1. katama, aor. _u {yakotumu}, inf. n. katomN [and kitomaAnN], doubly trans., He concealed, or suppressed, a secret. (Mgh.)
katama Alr-abowa: see a verse cited in the last paragraph of art. Ewr.
5. takat-ama (Ḳ, art. dls) He (a man) concealed, or hid, himself. (T, Ḳ, same art.)
6. takaAtamuwA They practised concealment, one with another: see tadaAfanuwA.
kaAtimN meaning makotuwmN: see daAfiqN, in two places.
fiI kaAtimi Als-ir-i: see a verse cited in conj. 3 of art. ErD.
kuj-apN, see bukosapN in the Ḳ and TA.
4. OakoHaTa: see OaqoHaTa, in two places.
1. kaHala † He put out, or blinded, an eye with a heated nail, &c.: see an ex. voce samara.
8. maA QkotaHalotu gamaADFA and gimaADFA, &c.: see OagomaDa. See also HavAavN.
10. AisotakoHala Als-ahara † [He became sleepless; as though he took sleeplessness as a collyrium]. (TA in art. Hls, from a trad.)
kaHolN and kaHolu (Ṣ, Ḳ) A year of drought, barrenness, or dearth; (Ṣ;) a hard year. (Ḳ.)
kuHayolN a proper name for A horse of high breed; as also kuHayolAanN↓. (TA.)
kuHayolN Tar (qaTiraAn) in the dial. of El-Ḥijáz. (TA, voce garobN; from the T.) See nfoZN.
kuHayolAanN: see kuHayolN.
EayonN kaHolaMCu An eye that is black, [or black in the edges of the lids,] by nature, as though it had kuHol applied to it. (Mgh.) Not in the TA. [It seems to have both of these meanings.]
kaHolaMCu A certain plant: see Ḳ, voce XinojaAr: calendula arvensis: see Delile, Flor. Aeg., no. 864.
AlOakoHalu The median vein. See wariydN and Oabojalu and Oaboharu and AlS-aAfinu.
1. kadama He bit with the fore part of the mouth. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
6. takaAdumu AlHumuri [The wild asses' biting one another with the fore part of the mouth]. (TA in art. sHj.) See also tasaAn-at.
kacobaAnuwnapN [Pers. kadobaAnw] An intelligent housewife, who is a good manager. (Ḳ, art. hlj; but omitted in some copies.)
kuciynaqN: see midaq-N, in art. dq-.
3. flAn yukaArizu En AlHq AlI AlbATl, inf. n. mukaArazapN: i. q. yuEaAjizu, expl. in art. Ejz. (TA, art. Ejz.)
7. Ainokarasa fiI AlX-aIoCi He entered into the thing and concealed himself. (IḲṭṭ, in TA, art. nms.)
kurosiI-u AlxaAtami (T, Ḳ, art. bZr) The bezel of the ring. (TḲ.)
kirosan-apN, thus written: (TA:) [Bitter vetch:] see xaAniqN.
kirosiniI-N [or karosaniI-N] A sort of Him-aS. (The Minháj, in TA, art. HmS.)
karXN or kiroXN The plant so named: see raqamapN.
kariySN A kind of OaqiT: see kavoCN.
mikoraSN: i. q. miDorab, q. v.
1. karaEa fiI AlmaMCi, and fiI AlUinaMCi, He put his mouth into the water, or into the vessel, and so drank. (See Eab-a.)
karAaEN: see Eid-N.
kuraAEN: see Har-apN, rakaDa, ciraAEN, and badanN.
kurosuwEN The prominent extremity of the ulna, next to the little finger, at the wrist. (Ṣ,* Ḳ.)
kurokiI-N The Numidian crane; ardea virgo: also called Uiwaz-N EirAaqiI-N, and waz-N EiraAqiI-N. See Oabuw AlEayozaAri and guronayoqN.
1. karuma, inf. n. karamN, It (a thing) was, or became, highly esteemed or prized or valued; excellent, precious, valuable, or rare: (Mṣb:) followed by Ealayohi: see 1 in art. fjE.

karumato OaroDuhu His land yielded increase of its seed-produce, (ISh, Ḳ,) and its soil became good, (ISh,) being manured; (ISh, Ḳ;) [or it was, or became, generous, or good; i. e., productive, or fertile].
karumotu Ealayohi, (Ṣ, Ḳ, art. Ez,) I exceeded him in generosity, or nobleness. (TḲ, voce Eaz-N.)
2. kar-amahu EalaI-a [He honoured him above me]. (Ḳur, xvii. 64).
kar-amahu Eano kacaA [He preserved him from such a thing]: see an ex. in a verse cited in art. El (conj. 3): and see, here, 4 and 5.
kar-ama He highly regarded a horse or the like.
See takorimapN.
4. Oakoramahu He treated him with honour, or courtesy.
Oakorama, and Aisotakorama↓, He found a generous horse (farasFA kariymFA). (TA in art. rbT.) See rabaTa.
Oakoramotu Eanohu EiroDiI I preserved myself from it. (Ṣ in art. ErD. See also 2.)
5. takar-ama Eanohu, and takaArama↓, He shunned it; avoided it; kept, or removed, himself far from it; or preserved himself from it; (Ḳ;) for in stance, from foul speech. (TA in art. dqE.)
takar-ama He affected, or constrained himself, to be generous. (Ṣ.)
6: see 5.
10. Aisotakorama AlX-aIoCa: see 10 in art. frh.
See also 4.
Uibonu Alkaromi The qiTof [i. e. grape, or bunch of grapes]. (T in art. bnI.)
karamN in a horse, &c., generous quality. See HasabN; and see kariymN, and makorumapN, and XariyfN.
cuw AljalaAli waAlUikoraAmi (Ḳur, lv. 27) Possessed of majesty, or greatness, and bounty: (Jel:) or, of absolute independence and universal bounty. (Bḍ.)
Alkurokumu AlS-agiyru: see AlEuruwqu AlS-uforu.
kariymN Generous; liberal; honourable: noble; high-born; contr. of laYiymN. (Ḳ, &c.)
[A generous, a noble, a high-bred, a well-born, or an excellent, horse, &c.; of generous, high, or good, breed or quality.]
A thing highly esteemed or prized or valued; excellent, precious, valuable, or rare. (Mṣb.)
[OaroDN kariymapN Productive land. See karumato OaroDuhu.]
baEiyrN kariymN EalaI Oaholihi [A camel held in high estimation by his owner]. (TA in art. dfE.)
[wajohu Qll-ehi Alkariymu means The glorious face of God: see an ex. voce suboHapN.]
karAaYimu AlmaAli (TA) or AlOamowaAli (Mgh, Mṣb) Such as are held in high estimation, precious, or excellent, of cattle or other possessions; (Mgh, Mṣb, TA;) the choice, or best, thereof. (Mgh, Mṣb.)
Hub-FA wakaraAmapN, see Hub-N.

karAamapN, the kind of miracle so called: pl. karaAmaAtN; like the term χαρίσματα as used by St. Paul in 1 Cor. xii. 9: it may be well rendered thaumaturgy: and SAaHibu karAamaAtK a thaumaturgus, or thaumaturgist: see muEojizahN, and qaraAsapN.
Oakoramu in the sense of kariymN, as in Oakoramuhumo OabFA: see bayaADN.
makoramapN A means. or cause, of attaining honour. (Mgh, Mṣb.)
makorumN: see OaluwkN and yusorN.
makorumapN A generous, or honourable, quality or action. (Mṣb, &c.)
EaliIa fiI AlmakaArimi [He became eminent in generous, or honourable, actions or practices or qualities or dispositions]. (Mṣb in art. Elw.)
makaArimu may often be rendered Excellencies.

OaroDN makorumapN and karamN↓ ‡ Generous, good, land: (Ḳ, TA:) [good and fertile land:] or dunged and tilled land. (TA.)
And OaroDN makorumapN liln-abaAvi ‡ Land producing good herbage or plants. (Ṣ, TA. [In some copies of the Ṣ, good for herbage or plants.])
1. karihahu [He disliked, was displeased with, disapproved of, hated, him or it.] AlkaraAhapu is the contr. of AlUiraAdapu and Alr-iDaI. (Marg. note in TA.)

karihahu (Mgh, Mṣb), inf. n. karaAhapN and karaAhiyapN, (Mgh,) or kurohN and karohN, (Mṣb,) He did not desire it; he disapproved it, or was displeased or discontented with it; (Mgh;) he disliked it; disapproved it; hated it; contr. of Hab-ahu. (Mṣb.)
kariha and takar-aha↓: see saxiTa.
2. kar-ahotu Uilayohi AlX-aIoCa, inf. n. takoriyhu, I made the thing to be an object of dislike, disapprobation, or hatred, to him. (Ṣ, Ḳ.*)
4. Oakorahotuhu EalaI kadaA I made him to do such a thing against his will. (Ṣ.)

takar-aha He expressed dislike, displeasure, disapprobation, discontent, or hatred. (IbrD.) See examples in the Ḳ, voce Oax-o, and voce Oaf-o, &c. The above is the prevailing signification, and often occurs.
takar-ahahu i. q. karihahu, q. v. (Ḳ,* TA.) See also taOaj-amahu.
6: see 5.
AlkarAahiyapu llX-aIoCi signifies AlbugoDu lahu and Eadama mulaACamatihi. (MF in art. AbI.)
kaArihN Unwilling: see an ex. voce OasaMCa.
makorahN A thing that one dislikes, disapproves, or hates, or that one dislikes to do: opposed to manoXaTN: (TA in art. nXT:) [a thing, or an event, that is an object of dislike or hatred].
makoruwhN Foul, abominable, or evil; i. q. say-iYN; (Beyd, xvii. 40;) and Xar-N: (TA:) [held in aversion]. See kariyhN.
makaArihu, a pl. of makoruwhN.
makaArihu Ald-ahori The afflictions, or calamities, of fortune; syn. nawaAziluhu and XadaAYiduhu. (TA.) See also makorahN.
musotakorahN: see an ex. voce EaraDN.
3. kaAraI EalaI daAb-api He employed a beast of carriage to carry for hire. (IbrD.)
4. OakorAaniI daArahu, and daAb-atahu, He let me his house, and his beast of carriage, on hire. (Mgh.)
6: see 8.
8. AikotaraI and AisotakoraI↓ and takaAraI↓ He hired, or took on hire a house, and a beast. (Mgh.)
karFI or karFA Drowsiness. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
kariI-N One who lets a thing on hire; (Mgh:) one who lets beasts on hire. (Mṣb.) See an ex. in a verse cited art. Xm, conj. 4.
And One who is hired. (Mgh, &c.) In one copy of the Mgh, AlmktriI is put by mistake for AlmukotaraI: i. q. mukorK: and mukotarFI. (TA in art. Hrm.)
kuriI-N Spherical: see Ksh in ii. 20.
kuriy-apN Sphericalness: see Bḍ in ii. 20.

karawoyA [Caraway-seed] is of the measure faEawolalN [and if so must be written karawoyFA]: (Ḳ:) or it may be faEawolFI: [but see what follows:] AHn says that, if with medd, it is fem. [and therefore karawoyaMCu]: but it is not Arabic [and therefore, without medd, it is probably karawoyaA]. (TA.)
karawaAnN: see DuwaEN and qabojN.
mukaArK One who lets beasts of carriage, &c., on hire; like kariI-N, q. v.; an owner, and letter on hire, of asses [&c.]. (KL.) See fal-aAHN.
kaAsifu AlbaAli: see baAlN.
kawosaqN i. q. kawosajN. (M.)
2. kas-alahu, inf. n. takosiylN, said of satiety, It rendered him heavy, sluggish, lazy, indolent, or torpid. (TA.)
4. Oakosala EanohaA signifies Oawolaja walamo yunozilo; [Inivit sed non emisit;] (IAạr, in TA, art. fhr;) [i. e., Oawolaja vum-a tarakahaA walamo yunozilo].
kasolaAnN Heavy, sluggish, lazy, indolent, torpid. (Ḳ.)
makosalapN: see an ex. voce kiT-apN.
1. kasawotuhu sayofFA [I invested him with a sword]. (TA in art. gXw.)
5. tksI: see tqI.
kisaMCN [A garment]. See EabaMCN, and HilosN and musay-aHN.

cuw kisaMCK, as opposed to cuwburodK, † A poor man. (Ṣ, art. Ej.) [The ksAC was evidently a simple oblong piece of cloth; for AlkisaAYiI is said to have been thus named because he wore a ksAC while in the state of UiHoraAm; as is mentioned in the TA, art. ksw; but it seems to have been sometimes sewed in the manner of the EabaMC, which see; and see also musay-aHN, and burodN.] It is [properly] not one of the garments which are cut and sewed [but is a single piece]: (Mgh, art. qTE:) [a wrapper, or wrapping garment, of a single piece].
rakiba kisaMCahu He fell upon the back of his neck. (IAạr, in TA, art. rdE.)
kaAsK Having clothing: see an ex. voce rub-a.
OakosaI: see baSalN.
1. kaXafahu and kaXafa Eanohu He uncovered it; unveiled it; laid it open; displayed it; exposed it to view; discovered it; detected it; revealed it; disclosed it.
kaXafa Eanohu He investigated, explored, or scrutinized, it; searched, examined, or inquired, into it.
kaXafahu He removed it; namely, a cover, or covering, or the like: and he uncovered it, laid it open,, &c.; as also kaXafa Eanohu.
kaXafa XayoOF Eano XaIoCK He removed, put off, took off, or stripped off, a thing from over, or from before, a thing which it covered or concealed. (Ḳ.)
kaXafa He removed, cleared away, or dispelled, grief, or sorrow: see faraja (of which it is an explanation in the Mṣb and Ḳ).
See 7.
3. kaAXafahu, inf. n. mukaAXafapN, [He acted openly with him, or towards him;] syn. of the inf. n. mujaAharapN. (Ḥar, p. 470.) He, or it, appeared to him; as also kaAXafa Ealayohi; syn. Zhr lh. (TA.)
kuwXifa bimaA Oaxofayotu He became acquainted with, knew, or got knowledge of, what I concealed: syn. UiT-alaEa Ealayohi. (Ḥar. p. 686.)

mukaAXafapN The showing open enmity, or hostility, with any one. (KL.) [I. e. kaAXafahu alone, or] kAXfh biAlEadaAwapi signifies He showed open enmity, or hostility, with him; (Ṣ, MA, Ḳ;) and so kAXfh AlEadaAwapa. (MA.) See SafoHapN.
[Also Discovery, or revelation: pl. mukaAXafaAtN: see Ḥájjee Khaleefeh, s. v.]
kaAXafahu AlHaroba [He made war with him openly]. (Mṣb, art. nbc.)
5. takaX-afa He uncovered, or exposed, himself in sitting. (TA, voce OaEofatu.)
6. takaAXafuwA They revealed their faults, or secrets, one to another: see tadaAfanuwA.
7. AinokaXafa Eanohu [He, or it, withdrew, or became withdrawn, or removed or became removed, from him, or it, or from over it]
AinokaXafato said of a she-camel: see mufan-anN.
AinokaXafuwA [They were routed, defeated, or put to flight; like kaXifuwA↓: the former is quasi-pass. of kaXafa, “he routed,”, &c.]. (Ḳ, voce jAl in art. jwl.) See also tiforijapN, in art. frj.
kaX-aAfN: see Ḥam, p. 49, 1. 2.
makoXuwfN Uncovered,, &c.; overt.
mukaAXifN [A discoverer, or revealer: thus I have rendered it voce EayonN.]
kaXokN Barley-water: (Ḳ:) or pounded wheat or barley: a Persian word, arabicized. (Mgh.) Hence, kaXokiy-apN A kind of broth. (Mgh.)
1. kaZama gayoZahu He repressed, or restrained, his wrath, or rage. (Ḳ.)
kaZama, aor. _i {yakoZimu}, inf. n. kaZomN, He restrained himself. (TA.)
maA yakoZimu EalaI jir-apK; and laA yakoZimN EalaI jir-atihi: see jir-apN.
kaZama EalaI gayoZihi i. q. kaZama gayoZahu. (TA.)
kaZaAYimu [pl. of kiZaAmapN] Subterranean conduits for water. (TA in art. qnw.)
kuEoburapN and kuEobuwrapN↓ Anything compact (Ḳ, TA) and round: (TA:) and the latter, i. q. EuqodapN [meaning a knot, or a knob]: (TA:) [pl. of the latter kaEaAbiyru: see xirowN: see also Oaxoramu].
Also The seed-vessel [i. e. siliqua, or pod,] of the radish and some other plants. (IAạr, TA voce UisoHaAr-N.)
kuEobuworapN: see kuEoburapN.

kaEokN A well-known bread; (Ḳ;) biscuit; (MA;) or [a kind of] dry bread: (MA, TA:) now applied to a sort of bread made in the form of a ring, hollow, [and generally containing some dbs or the like,] the best of which is brought from Syria, and given as a present. (TA.)
kuEalN: see vuEalN.
1. kaEama AlbaEiyra: see Eakama.
kiEaAmN A muzzle for a camel. (PṢ.)
kiEaAmapN The iron thing that embraces, or clasps, (talotaqimu,) the muzzle of the horse. (IDrd in his book on the Saddle and Bridle, p. 8.)
1. kaf-a Alt-awoba He sewed the edge, or border, of the garment, or piece of cloth, the second time, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) after the [slight] sewing termed Almal-u, (Ṣ,) or AlX-al-u. (Ḳ.)
[He felled (a seam or garment).]
kaf-a Eanohu, aor. _u {yakofufu}, He refrained, or forbore, from it, as forbidden; abstained, or desisted, from it; left, relinquished, or forsook it: (Mṣb:) [as also Ankf-↓].
kaf-a Eanohu He refrained, desisted, forbore, abstained, or held, from it. (Ḳ, &c.)

kaf-ahu Eanohu He made him to refrain, forbear, or abstain, from it; averted him, turned him away or back, from it; (Ḳ;) prevented, hindered, held, withheld, or restrained, him from it. (Mgh, Mṣb, TA.)
[kaf-a bayonahumaA He interposed as a restrainer between them two: a phrase of frequent occurrence].
kaf-a mina AlX-aEari (M, Ḳ, art. qSr) He shortened the hair. (M, ibid.)
3. kaAf-uwA Eaduw-ahumo i. q. HaAjazuwhumo, which see.
mukaAf-apN signifies i. q. muHaAjazapN, because it is a preventing, or an abstaining, from fighting. (Mgh.)
7: see 1.
kaf-N [generally The hand: sometimes, app., the palm only:] accord. to Az, the palm with the fingers. (Mṣb.)
[Hence, A cake of the length and thickness of the hand: thus in the present day. See Euj-aAlN.]
kaf-N A handful; what one takes with the hand, or grasps; syn. quboDapN. (Ṣ, art. qbD.)
[Darabahu kaf-FA He struck him a slap with the hand.]
[kaf-N often signifies The paw of a beast.]
kaf-apN: see kif-apN.

kuf-apN The selvage, i. e. border, or side, of a garment or piece of cloth, (Ṣ, Mṣb,) that has no hudob [or end of unwoven threads]: (Ṣ, voce Tur-apN:) or what surrounds the skirt of a shirt: or whatever is oblong; as the HaAXiyap of a garment or piece of cloth, and of sand: and the edge of a thing. (Ḳ.)
kif-apN The bezel, or collet, i. e. the part in which the stone is set, of a signet-ring. (TA in art. rkb.) See kurosiI-N.
See also TaroqN.
kif-apN A scale of a balance: (MA:) vulg. kaf-apN↓. (Ḳ.)
kafaAfN The like of a thing. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
Food, or sustenance, that renders one independent of others: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) or sufficient for one's want, not exceeding nor falling short. (Mṣb.)
kifaAfN The circuit, rim, or surrounding edge, of a thing. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
kifaAfapN [app. a subst., not an inf. n.,] The act, or art, of sewing in the manner termed kaf-N; (TA;) contr. of XilaAXapN. (TA in art. Xl.)
kaAf-apN An old and weak she-camel. (AO, TA in art. sdm.)
[maA kaAf-apN The restrictive maA, which is annexed to Oan-a Uin-a, &c.: so called because it restrains the particle to which it is adjoined from exercising any government.]
kaAf-apF Wholly. (Bḍ and Jel in ii. 204.)
Harofu mukaAfaOapK A particle denoting compensation, or the complement of a condition; like Harofu jazaMCK.

1. kafala baAlmaAli He was, or became, responsible, answerable, accountable, amenable, surety, or guarantee, for the property (Mṣb) owed by another person: (IbrD:) [it may be rendered he guaranteed the property. See makofuwlN].
kafala baAln-afosi He was, or became, responsible, answerable, amenable, or surety, for another person, (Mṣb,) i. e., for the latter's appearance, or presence, to answer a suit. (IbrD.)
kafalN The Eajuz [or hinder part, posteriors, buttocks, or rump]: (Mṣb, Ḳ:) or the ridof [or hindermost part] thereof: or the [part called] qaTan. (Ḳ.)
kafiylN One who is responsible, answerable, amenable, or a sponsor or surety. (Ṣ, Ḳ, &c.)

kafaAlapN Responsibility; answerableness; amenability; or suretiship; (Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ;) the conjoining of one responsibility (cim-ap) to another, [i. e., the conjoining one's own responsibility to that of another person,] with respect to the right of suit, [so that one person becomes liable to be sued for that which another owes]; (Mgh;) i. q. DamaAnN. (Ṣ, &c.)
mikofaAlN A woman large in the kafal [or hinder part, or posteriors]. (TA in art. vql.)

makofuwlN app. signifies Guaranteed, or pledged: for, accord. to IḲṭṭ, as is said in the Mṣb, you say kafalotu AlmaAla as well as kafalotu biAlmaAli; meaning I took upon myself the property; became responsible, or answerable, for it; [or I guaranteed it:] or makofuwlN is better rendered ensured by an acknowledgment of responsibility for it: see an ex. voce marohuwnN.
5. takaf-anuwA bOanoTaAEK [They wrapped themselves with AnTAE for grave-clothing]. (TA, art. HnT.)
4. Aikofahara, said of clouds: see a verse cited EazolaMCu.

1. kafaI He, or it, sufficed, or contented: hence kafaAniI fulaAnN AlOamora Such a one sufficed me, or contented me, in respect of the affair; i. e., by taking upon himself to perform it or accomplish it if good, or to prevent it or avert it if evil: and kafaAniI XahiydFA He sufficed me as, or for, a witness; or he suffices me as, or for, such: and sometimes bi is redundantly prefixed to its agent, and sometimes to its objective complement; as in exs. cited in art. b. See Ḥam, p. 152. kafaI [It sufficed, or satisfied, or contented,] it stood instead of another thing, or other things; (Mṣb;) [as also kafaI Eano gayorihi.]
kafaI binaA for kafaAnaA, &c. See W, pp. 5 and 6

kafaI, aor. yakofiI, inf. n. kifaAyapN, also signifies dafaEa and manaEa followed by mino. (Ḥar, p. 43, q. v.) [You say, kafaAhu AlX-ar-a He repelled from him evil; and hence, he defended him therefrom; and he freed him therefrom: said of God, and of a man, &c.]
8. AikotafaI biAlX-aIoCi He was, or became, sufficed by the thing, so as to need nothing more; or content with it. (Mṣb.)
kifaAyapN A sufficiency; enough; a thing that suffices, or contents, and enables one to obtain what one seeks. (TA, art. blg.)
qaAma bikifaAyatihi He undertook his maintenance; he maintained him; syn. maAnahu. (Ṣ, Ḳ, art. mwn.)
OakofaI [More, and most, satisfying]. (Mgh, in art. jzO.)
kaAkanajN or kaAkanojN [Pers. kaAkonajo]: see EubabN.
1. kal-a It (the sight) was, or became, dim, dull, or hebetated. (Ḳ.)
He (a camel) was, or became, fatigued, tired, or wearied. (MA.)
kal-ato OasonaAnuhu, (Ḳ, art. Drs,) inf. n. kalaAlN, (Ṣ, in that art.,) His teeth were set on edge, (TḲ, in that art.,) by eating, or drinking, what was acid, or sour. (Ṣ, Ḳ, in that art.)
kal-a It (a sword, &c.) was blunt, and would not cut. (Ḳ, &c.)
kul-atuhun-a for kul-uhun-a: see Bḍ xxxi., last verse.
2. kal-ala He adorned a thing with gems or jewels.
4. Oakal-a OasonaAnahu [It set his teeth on edge]; said of acid, or sour, food or drink. (Ibn-ʼAbbád, in TA, art. Drs.) See 1.

kal-N A burden; syn. viqolN: (Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ:) a person, or persons, whom one has to support: syn. Eay-alN, (Ḳ,) and EiyaAlN: (Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ:) applied to one and to more. (Mṣb.) See an ex. voce cim-apN (last sentence but two).

kul-N when preceded by a negative and followed by an exception, means Any one; as in the Ḳur, xxxviii. 13, Uino kul-N Uil-aA kac-aba Alr-usula There was not any one but accused the apostles of lying. See also another ex. voce lam-aA.
See baEoD.

huwa AlEaAlimu kul-u AlEaAlimi [lit. He is the possessor of knowledge, the entirety of the possessor of knowledge,] means that he is one who has attained to the utmost degree of the quality thus attributed to him. (Sb, Ḳ, TA.)

sense.hi: Whenever; as often as; every time that; in proportion as.

entry.sense: kil-apN [musquito-curtain]: see Oabuw divaArK and baEaDa.
kul-iI-N Relating to all or the whole; universal; total: and often meaning relating to the generality; general; contr. of juzoYiI-N.
And, as a subst., A universal; that which comprises all juzoYiy-aAt, or particulars: pl. kul-iy-aAtN.
kul-iy-apN The quality of relating to all or the whole; relation to all or the whole; universality; totality: and often meaning the quality of relating to the generality; generality.
Alkul-iy-aAtu Alxamosu, in logic, The Five Predicables: namely, Aljinosu Genus, Aln-awoEu Species, AlfaSolu Difference, AlxalS-apu Property, and AlEaraDu Accident.
kaliylN Weak, or faint, lightning [app. likened to a blunt sword]. (TA in art. Eml.)
kaliylu AlZ-ufori: see ZuforN.
lisaAnN kaliylN A dull tongue; lacking sharpness. (Ṣ.*)
wariva rajulFA kalaAlapF, and Eano kalaAlapK, He was heir of a man who left neither parent nor offspring (IbrD.)
AlUikoliylu The 17th Mansion of the Moon; (Ḳzw;) the head of Scorpio. (Aboo-l-Heythem, quoted in the TA, voce raqiybN.)
AlUikoliylu Three bright stars in [or rather before] the head of Scorpio, [namely g, h, and q,] disposed in a row, transversely.
The border of flesh round the nail: (Ḳ:) in the TA, art. XZf, Uikoliylu AlZ-ufuri.
mukal-alN Adorned with gems or jewels. (L, art. njd; a common meaning.)

1. kalifa bihi He became attached, addicted, given, or devoted, to it; or he attached, addicted, gave, or devoted, himself to it; (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ, TA;) he loved it: (Mṣb, TA:) [he was fond of it:] he loved him, [or it,] vehemently. (TA.)
kalafN, inf. n. of kalifa: [violent or intense love:] see Hub-N; and see a verse cited in the first paragraph of that art.
2. kal-afa nafosahu XayoYFA He tasked himself with a thing, as also takal-afa XayYFA↓.

sense.hi: He tasked him to do a thing; imposed upon him the task of doing a thing.

entry.sense: So takoliyfN The imposition of a task or duty.

sense.hi: A task; compulsory work; a duty imposed.

entry.sense: kal-afahu AlOamora He imposed upon him the thing, or affair; syn. Ham-alahu Uiy-aAhu. (Mṣb.)
kal-afa nafosahu He put himself to trouble or inconvenience; like takal-afa↓ alone.
kal-afahu kacaA He imposed upon him the task of doing, or procuring, or bringing, such a thing.

kal-afahu OamorFA He imposed upon him a thing, or an affair, in spite of difficulty, trouble, or inconvenience: (Mṣb:) he ordered him to do a thing that was difficult, troublesome, or inconvenient, to him: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) he made, required, or constrained, him to do a thing; exacted of him the doing a thing; meaning, a thing that was difficult, troublesome, or inconvenient to him: (Kull, 123; and the Lexicons, passim.) See jaX-amahu.

sense.hi: An imposition; a requisition: con straint, &c.

entry.sense: 5. takal-afa OamorFA He [undertook a thing, or an affair, as imposed upon him: or] took, or imposed, upon himself, or undertook, a thing, or an affair, [as a task, or] in spite of difficulty, trouble, or inconvenience; (Mṣb;) syn. tajat-amahu: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) he constrained, or tasked, or exerted, himself, or took pains, or made an effort, to do a thing; meaning, a thing that was difficult, troublesome, or inconvenient, to him: or he affected, as a self-imposed task, the doing of a thing. (The Lexicons, passim: see tgz-l: and see kal-afahu OamorFA.)
tkl-f SifapF He affected, or endeavoured to acquire, a quality. So in the explanations of verbs of the measure tafaE-ala; as naHal-ama. (Sharh El-'Izzee, by Saad-ed-Keen.)

Also, He affected, or pretended to have, a quality, not having it. So in the explanations of verbs of the measure tafaAEala, as tajaAhala: (idem:) [and sometimes in verbs of the measure tafaE-ala also, as takas-ara, &c.]. And takal-afa alone, He exercised self-constraint, or put himself to trouble or inconvenience.
takal-afa He affected what was not natural to him.

takal-afa He used forced efforts to do a thing, and to appear to have a quality. He affected, or endeavoured to do or acquire, &c.; he constrained himself to do, &c.; he applied himself, as to a task, to do a thing. tkl-f AlX-ajaAEapa He made himself, or constrained himself to be, courageous; affected, or endeavoured to acquire, or characterize himself by, courage.
tkl-f AlX-ajaAEapa also, He acted, or behaved, with forced courage; endeavoured to be courageous.

sense.hi: He used a forced, or affected, manner in his Arabic speech.

entry.sense: takal-ufN A straining of a point in lexicology.

taEaq-ala signifies He affected or endeavoured to acquire, intelligence; explained by tkl-f AlEaqola: and taEaAqala, he pretended to be intelligent, not being really so. (Ṣ, art. Eql.) takal-ufN in a verb of the measure tafaE-ala is as above explained, signifying a desire for the existence of an attribute in one's self: in a verb of the measure tafaAEala it is different, and means the pretending to be or to do something which in reality one is not or does not; as in the instance of tajaAhala, he pretended to be ignorant, not being so in reality. (Sharh El-'Izzee, by Saad-ed-Deen.) takal-afa kacaA He did so purposely.
takal-afa AlqaIoCa He vomited intentionally. (TA, art. qIC.)
kalafN [A discolouration of the face, by] a thing that comes upon the face resembling sesame; [by freckles, accord. to present usage:] and a dingy redness that comes upon the face. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)

kulofapN A difficulty, or difficult affair, or a duty, or an obligation, that one imposes upon himself; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) or a thing imposed upon one as difficult, troublesome, or inconvenient. (Mṣb.) See Hab-N.
[Constraint,] trouble, pain, or inconvenience. (MA.)
3. kaAlamahu i. q. naATaqahu. (TA in art. nTq.)
5. takal-ama ganohu He spoke for him; syn. Eab-ara. (Ṣ, Mṣb, art. Ebr.)
6. takaAlamaA They spoke, talked, or discoursed, each with the other. (Ṣ,* M.)
kalimapN A word: (Kull, 301:) an expression: (Ḳ:) a proposition: a sentence: [a saying:] an argument. (Kull.) An assertion: an expression of opinion.

kalaAmN is a gen. n., applying to little and to much, or to few or many; (Ṣ, TA;) to what is a sing. and to what is a pl. (TA.) It may therefore be rendered A saying, &c.; and sayings, or words: see an ex. voce Oafokalu, in art. fkl.
kalaAmN Speech; something spoken; [diction; language;] parlance; talk; discourse: (Mṣb, &c.:) a saying: a say: something said: in grammar, a sentence. Alkalimu AlT-ay-ibu: see Tay-itN.

kalaAmN: also, a quasi-inf. n. for tklym, sometimes governing as a verb, [like the inf. n.,] accord. to some of the grammarians; as in the following ex.:
qAlwA klAmk hndAF whI mSgyp
yXfyk qlt SHyH cAk lw kAnA . (Sharh Shudhoor edh-Dhahab.) See Uisomu maSodarK.

Eilomu AlkalaAmi [The theology of the Muslims;] a science in which one investigates the being and attributes of God, and the conditions of possible things with respect to creation and restitution, according to the rule of El-Islám; which last restriction is for the exclusion of the theology of the philosophers. (KT.)
rajulN kil-iymN, like sik-iyt- [and Hid-iyvN] i. q. minoTiyqN. (Ibn-ʼAbbád, Z, TA.)
kuloyapN of a bow: see Oaboharu
of a mazaAdap: see xurobapN.
mutakal-imN A Muslim theologian. See Eilomu AlkalaAmi.
1. kalaA, first pers. kalaAtu, aor. yakoluw; and kalaA, first pers. kalayotu, aor. yakolaA; inf. n., kilaAyapN; see kalaOa.
AlkulaI: the feathers so called: see manaAkibu and Oaboharu.
AlkuloyataAni A name of two stars on the ear of Taurus. (See AlkalobaAni.)
kamo: see its syn. kaOaI-K or kaOay-ino voce OaI-N.

As an interrogative with the specification suppressed, What number? How many? and, as in an ex. voce siqoIN, virtually meaning How much? and so in an ex. voce masaAfapN and voce XaborN. Also How long? as in the Ḳur, ii. 161, &c.; a noun signifying a period of time being understood: see also an ex. voce Easafa, and voce faraXa.
kam-N and kamN are both app. right: see qado.
kim-N The calyx of a flower. (Ḳ, &c.)
kim-N The envelope [or spathe] of the TaloE [or spadix of a palm-tree]: and the covering [or calyx] of flowers or blossoms; as also kimaAmapN↓. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
kum-apN A qalanosuwap: (TA in art. bTH:) or a round qlnswp: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) pl. kimaAmN. (Ḳ,* TA in art. bTH.)
kimaAmapN: see kim-N.
kam-iy-apN Quantum, or quantity, as answering to “how many.”
mukam-amN Covered over, or concealed (masotuwr). (Ṣ, art. xSb.) See buroOap.
kamokaAmN The cancamum-tree: see buTomN and DirowN.

sense.hi: A kind of belt with a receptacle for money.

entry.sense: kamaAfiyoTuws [χαμαίπιτυς, the ground-pine]: see EaroSafN.
1. kamala He, or it, was, or became, perfect; and sometimes, it was, or became, complete, entire, whole, or full; which latter signification is more properly expressed by tam-a, which see.
kaAmlN Complete with respect to bodily vigour, having attained the usual term thereof. See layovu Eifir-iyna, art. Efr. Also Consummate, perfect.
Eayonu AlkamaAli: see faqaOa.
AlkaAmaAnu AlmucaAbu, mentioned in the TA, in art. nbT, i. q. Eiloku AlOanobaAT, which is applied as a lzwq to a wound.
makomanN A place of concealment, a lurking-place: (Mgh, Mṣb:) pl. makaAminu. (Mṣb.)
OaroDN kamohaMCN i. q. mugim-apN and migam-apN. (TA in art. gm.)
kamiI-N A courageous man: or one wearing arms or armour: (Ḳ:) or a courageous man covered, or protected, by arms or armour; (Ṣ;) a courageous armed man.
kin-N A place of retreat or concealment; such as a cave, and an excavated house or chamber: (Beyd, xvi. 83:) see bar-N.
kin-N The shelter of a wall: see difoCN.
A thing that serves for veiling, covering, or protecting. (Ṣ,* Mṣb,* Ḳ.) See Zil-N, where I have thus rendered it.
kun-apN: see TanafN.
kinaAnapN: see jaEobapN.
kaAnuwnN A fire-place; a place in which fire is lighted. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
makonuwnu AlfaAYili: see a verse of El-Aạshà in art. fyl.
fAEl musotakin-N: see musotaqinN.
kanoxabapN Confusion of speech, or discourse, by reason of errors, or mistakes. (Yoo, Ḳ.) [App. an inf. n. of which the verb is kanoxaba.]
kaniysN [a kind of roast flesh-meat]: see maromuwDN.
8. Aikotanafahu Alqawomu The people were on his right and left. (Mṣb.)

sense.hi: It bordered it on either side.

entry.sense: kanafN Vicinage or neighbourhood, or region or quarter or tract, and shadow or shelter or protection. (Ḳ.)
kanafaA AlUinosaAni The man's two sides, right and left. (TA.)
kanuwfN: see qacuwrN, in two places.
kaniyfN: see zirobN.

kunaAfapN A kind of pastry, resembling vermicelli, made of fine flour and water mixed in such proportions as to compose a thin paste, which is poured into a vessel whose bottom is pierced with numerous small holes: the vessel being then moved circuitously over a large round tray of tinned copper, beneath which is a fire, the paste runs in fine streams, is quickly but slightly baked. and swept off. For eating, it is slightly baked with clarified butter (smn), and then sweetened with honey, or sometimes with treacle, or sugar.
kunaAfapN i. q. Pers. riXotaho qaTaAYifo [Thread katáïf]. (KL.) See UiToriyapN.
kanafaAniI-N A maker or seller of kunaAfap.
mukaAnifN A she-camel that lies down behind the other camels. (Az, cited in L, art. rwH.)
4. Oakonaha: see an ex. in a verse cited voce maEas-N.
kunohN: see faS-N.
kunohN may often be rendered Entity.

1. kanaI He affixed a kinaAyap, meaning, with the Koofees, a pronoun, to a verb [&c.]: (TA in art. ryb:) but accord. to the usage of the verb in two instances in the M and Ḳ, voce raAba in art. ryb, it clearly means he spoke allusively.
kanaIa bihi Eano kadam, He used it metonymically for such a word or phrase; he alluded thereby to such a thing.
kinaAyapN A metonymy: see taEoriyDN; where the difference between these two words is explained.
Also, An allusion. (TA.)
mukan-K and mukan-aI:see kinaAyapN.
kuhobapN, accord. to Ibn El-Aạrábee, Yellowness inclining to redness. (TA. voce Husobap.)
8. Aikotahala, said of a plant, It became tall and full-grown: (TA:) or it became of its full height, and blossomed: (Ṣ:) see zaAxirN.
kaholN Of middle age; or between that age and the period when his hair has become intermixed with heaviness. See XabaAbN; and XayoxN and gulaAmN.
kuhuwlapN: see XabaAbN.

kaAhilN [The withers of a horse, &c.] i. q. HaArikN: or the anterior portion of the upper part of the back, next the neck, which is the upper third part, containing six vertebra: or the part between the two shoulder-blades: or the part where the neck is joined to the back how: [the base of the neck: see vabajN]. (Ḳ.)
kihaAnapN Divination: soothsaying. (Ḳ, &c.)
kaAhinN: see Ear-aAfN and EaAYifN.
kArI [kaAriI-N?] i. q. gariybN, applied to a man. (AA, in TA, voce gariybN.)
kuwEN The extremity of the radius, or bone of the fore-arm, next the thumb: (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ:) or the protuberance formed thereby.
5. takaw-afa: see taXaO-ama.
kaAfN Same as kus-N (because it is the name of the incipient letter of this word: 1001 Nights ii. 304).
kuwfiy-apN A thing that is worn upon the head; so called because of its roundness, or its bring round. (TA.)
8. AikotaAma He walked upon the extremities of his toes, by choice. (TA, voce HaAriqapN, q. v.)

1. kaAna He or it was. A verb of the class called incomplete, (naAqiSN) because, with the agent which it comprises, or to which it relates, it cannot constitute a complete proposition; i. e., non-attributive. The other verbs of this class are, SaAra, OaSobaHa, OamosaI, OaDoHaI, Zal-a, baAta, maA zaAla, maA bariHa, maA fatiYa, maA Qnofak-a, maA daAma, and layosa. Each of these governs its noun, or subject, in the nom. case, and its enunciative, or predicate, in the acc. case; as, kaAna zayodN qaAYimFA Zeyd was standing.
(The n in yakuno and the like is often irregularly elided.)

kaAna, divested of all signification of time. is often used as a copula. (See De Sacy 's Gr. Ar. i. 196.) So too is kaAYinN; for hecaA zayodN and hecaA kaAYinN zayodFA signify the same. (Mughnee, voce Oan-a.)
kaAna as a complete, i. e., an attributive, verb, see HaSala. in three places.
5. takaw-ana He, or it, received, or took, his, or its, being, or existence; came into existence; originated.
10. AisotakaAna He was, or became lowly, humble, submissive, or in a state of abasement. (Ḥar, p. 4, q. v.) See Aisotakana in art. kyn.
naEuwcu biQll-ehi mn AlHawori baEoda Alkawoni: see HaworN and kaworN.
kayonuwnapN: see XaAxa.
makaAnapN A particular place of being or existence. See an ex. voce nafosN.
makaAnaka wazayodFA [Keep where thou art and approach not Zeyd!] Heard by Ks. (L, art. End.)
State, or condition. [Bḍ, xi. 122, and xxxix. 40.] See art. mkn.
makaAnN i. q. manozilapN. (Bḍ, xii. 77.)

sense.hi: This is a ground for our saying thus.

entry.sense: OaSobaHa makaAna kacaA It became as, or like, such a thing. See a verse cited voce ratomN.
1. kawaAhu He (a veterinary, and any other, TA) cauterized him; i. e. burned his skin; with an iron, and the like: (Ḳ:) or he burned him with fire. (Mgh.)
kay-isN Intelligent; ingenious, clever. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.) [Plur. kuwsaI:] also OakoyaAsN. (Mṣb.)
Oum-u kayosaAna a metonymical name of The knee, in the dial. of El-Azd. (TA, art. rkb)
kiySN: see daniyqN.

2. kay-afotuhu fatakay-afa, used by the Muslim theologians, (Ḳ, TA,) verbs derived from kayofa, (TA,) [signifying I specified by the ascription of its quality and it became so specified,] are formed in accordance with analogy, not heard from the Arabs. (Ḳ,* TA.)
5. takay-afa: see what next precedes {2}.
kayofiy-apN Quality as answering to “how?”; mode, or manner, of being.
kayofuwfiy-apN for kayofiy-apN: see tayosiy-apN.
8. AikotaAla Ealayohi and minohu: see EalaI in the sense of mino.
kayolN: see mikoyaAlN.
kay-aAlN [A measurer of corn and the like]. (A, art. bxs.)
mikoyaAlN A measure with which corn is measured; (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ;) as also kayolN↓; (Mṣb;) a measure of capacity.
10. AisotakaAna: see Aisotakana in art. skn: and see art. kwn.
kayonN (also written kayonapN, Ḳ, voce zaronabN): see baZorN.
kayohFA A large, or bulky, she-camel: see the last sentence in art. gcw.
